name: Reitveld Mosquito Coffee Table
description:
Glass and steel coffee table by Dutch designer Wim Rietveld for Gispen.  Model 535 MUG or Mosquito.  1950s Netherlands.

The table is in good vintage condition.  Light signs of use to the glass and some wear of the metal base due to age.  All rubber feet and supports are in place.

Dimensions: Dia 73cm x H 48 cm

name: DU02 Sideboard by Cees Braakman for Pastoe
description:
Teak sideboard designed by Cees Braakman for Pastoe.  1950s Netherlands.

This cabinet, model DU02, formed part of the Japanese Series with its characteristic thin black metal legs and black inserted handles.  The interior has one adjustable shelf.

The piece is in good condition, with minimal traces of usage and wear.

Dimensions: W 110cm x H 72cm x D 45cm

name: Pair of Pilastro 8000 Chairs
description:
Pair of low easy chairs by Tjerk Reijenga for Pilastro.  Early models of these rare chairs with screw fixings, grey metal frame and teak plywood seat, back and armrests. 1960s Netherlands.

The chairs have their original paintwork and the plywood panels have had some light restoration and are in very good condition.  All feet are in place.

Dimensions: H 64cm x W 71cm x D 60cm

name: Wall-Mounted Tomado Shelving
description:
Wall-mounted modular shelving unit by D Dekker for Tomado.  1950s Holland.

The piece comprises four metal uprights with eight metal shelves.  Metal pieces are stamped with the TOMADO-HOLLAND mark and are in good overall condition.

Dimensions:  H: 67 cm x D: 19 cm x W: 190 cm

We also have a smaller set available in teak, with unusual small ladders (shown in image 3); please contact us if you would like more information.

name: Hans Olsen Roundette Dining Suite
description:
Roundette dining suite designed in the early 1960s by Hans Olsen for Frem Røjle of Denmark.  

The teak and afromosia suite comprises six three-legged chairs which fit neatly into position in the apron of the table top.  The table is an extending model the butterfly leaf folding under the table top when not in use, and the spare chairs stack easily.  The chairs have their original black vinyl upholstery to seat and back rest, and all pieces are labelled.

Dimensions: H: 74cm x Dia: 106cm (156cm when extended) | Seat height: 44cm

name: Cees Braakman EB02 Desk for Pastoe
description:
Birch Series EB02 desk by Cees Braakman for UMS Pastoe. Netherlands 1950s. 

Desk in birch wood with bent ply legs, two drawers and a bookshelf on the visitor's side for storage, which means the piece is ideal for use in open space.  This limited edition desk has a teak top and afromosia detailing.

The piece is in good condition, with minimal signs of use and age.

Dimensions: D: 72cm x W: 123cm x H: 72cm

name: Pair of Eames Soft Pad Chairs
description: Pair of Eames Soft Pad Chairs, model EA208 with polished aluminium frames and tan leather upholstery.  The chairs are stamped with the Herman Miller logo and are very good in condition.

name: Hairpin-Leg Desk by Cees Braakman for Pastoe
description:
Teak writing desk with four hairpin-legs and bakelite drawer pulls, designed by Cees Braakman for Pastoe.  1950s Netherlands.

This desk has an asymmetric design with floating top. It is in very good original unrestored condition with normal signs of use.  Overall the desk shows a very nice patina associated with age.  

Dimensions: W*: 112cm x D: 60cm x H: 76cm

*Width of desk top: 100cm

name: Large Belarti Table
description:
Large coffee table with tiled top by J Belarti in tones of orange, yellow and black.  The table has a chrome frame with a black steel surround to the top.  1960s Belgium.

The table presents well and is in good overall condition. The are light traces of wear to the tiles but, importantly, no chips or cracks.

Dimensions: L 109cm x W 63cm x H 36cm

name: Eames Lounge Chair & Ottoman
description:
Lounge chair and ottoman - models 670 and 671 - designed by Charles and Ray Eames in 1956 for Herman Miller.  

This set dates from the late 1970s or possibly early 1980s and was made by Herman Miller in Bath, England, with rosewood plywood body and black leather upholstery, both in excellent condition.  

The set is not in our showroom, but is kept nearby, so if you would like to view - or have any questions - please drop us a note.

name: Willy Van Der Meeren Desk
description:
Writing desk by Willy Van Der Meeren.  Belgium 1953.

Willy van der Meeren (1923-2002) was a Belgian architect and designer, who was once a pupil of Le Corbusier. In the 1950s he created a number of pieces for Tubax - a manufacturer regarded as a pioneer of Modernism in Belgium - including simple multi-coloured wardrobes for schools, and the writing desks seen here.

This piece comprises original plywood and grey formica top, and black steel frame.  The desk is shown with a plywood and steel chair - also by Tubax - which is listed separately.

Dimensions:  H: 79 cm x W: 80 cm x D: 55 cm

name: Wim Rietveld Pyramid Table
description:
Rare Pyramid table with black folded metal frame and formica top, designed by Wim Rietveld for Ahrend de Cirkel.  The design, which allows the tables to be stacked, received the Signe d'Or award in 1960.

This piece has minimal traces of use and age; all rubber feet are intact and the Ahrend stamp appears on the frame.

The elegant metal base can be unscrewed so the top can be replaced to suit your needs, using glass or wood, in a similar or larger size.  The piece is sold here with its original formica top in a light linen pattern.

Wim Rietveld (Netherlands, 1924 - 1985) was the youngest son of the pioneering architect and designer Gerrit Rietveld. 

Dimensions:  H: 75 cm x W: 110 cm (table top 100 cm) x D: 70 cm

The chairs shown here are not available for sale.  Please contact us if you are interested in these pieces or something similar.

name: Nest of Tables
description:
Nest of three tables with metal frames.  One set in rosewood; one set in teak.  1950s Netherlands.

The tables are in good vintage condition, with a nice patina.  All show signs of use and age-related wear to the veneer.  The rosewood tables have felt panels on the frames, to protect the tables below; all feet pads are in place.

name: Cordemeijer "Cleopatra" Daybed
description:
Original "Cleopatra" daybed designed by Dick Cordemeijer for Auping.  1950s Netherlands.

The daybed has a light grey enameled steel frame, strong wire mesh base and rounded end panels in blue.  Newly upholstered in grey felt over new foam mattress and bolster cushion.

Dimensions: H*: 26 cm x L: 208 cm x W: 84 cm

* Height of mesh frame

***
This daybed is also available in dark grey metal with teak ends (see image 4 for an example) and can be upholstered in felt, hopsack or linen.  Please contact us if you would like more detailed information.

name: Cees Braakman EE02 Desk for Pastoe
description:
EE02 writing desk, with single pedestal and bent plywood legs, designed by Cees Braakman for UMS Pastoe of Utrecht, Netherlands. This desk was part of the "oak series" which was designed in 1948.

The desk has three drawers and shelf to the left and two bent ply legs to the right.  The drawers are lined with curved ply to give a soft interior finish. The desk is in good original condition with signs of use and the patina associated with its age. 

Dimensions: W: 125cm x D: 62cm x H: 73cm

Cees Braakman was head of the Pastoe design team from 1945 to 1978 and was responsible for the development of their first modern furniture line.  UMS Pastoe have recently celebrated their 100 year anniversary with an exhibition - "Like Pastoe" - at the Kunsthal in Rotterdam.

name: Friso Kramer Revolt Chairs
description:
Pair of Revolt chairs with arms, designed by Friso Kramer for Ahrend de Cirkel in 1953.  These chairs have folded metal frames in light grey with an unusual combination of teak plywood seats and back rests, with white arms.  They are in good vintage condition, with some signs of use and age, and a nice patina to the wood.  These chairs have the Ahrend stamp on the back of the frame.

Friso Kramer (Netherlands 1922) is a highly influential designer. He produced numerous pieces for De Cirkel in the period 1948-63; he then founded the Total Design bureau with Wim Crouwel, Benno Wissing, Paul and Dick Schwartz.  His designs are now highly sought after and a plastic version of the Revolt Chair was reissued by Ahrend in 2004.  The "Revolt" chair was recently celebrated in a unique exhibition at Galerie Catherine Houard in Paris.

Dimensions: 
H: 77cm x W: 60cm x D: 50cm 
Seat height 47cm / Arm height 69cm

name: Friso Kramer Revolve Chair
description: The Revolve chair is now sold, but we have one Resort chair available, as seen in the second picture. Please contact us if you would like more details. *** "Revolve" desk chair designed by Dutch designer Friso Kramer, for Ahrend de Cirkel in 1960; with a flat grey steel frame, original black vinyl seat and back rest and adjustable swivel base. This piece is from 1969 and is stamped with the Ahrend mark. Dimensions: H 85 cm x W 64 cm x D 51 cm

name: Friso Kramer Result Chairs
description:
Set of four compass-leg Result chairs by Friso Kramer for Ahrend de Cirkel, Netherlands.  These chairs were first designed in collaboration with Wim Rietveld in 1957, and won the Signe d'Or.

The chairs are from the first series, with folded steel metal frames in light grey, and teak plywood seats and backrests.   They are in very good vintage condition with some signs of wear to the enameling on the chair frame and to the wooden seats & backrests, consistent with age and use.  Each chair has its rubber feet in place, and is marked with the Ahrend stamp on the back of the frame.  

Friso Kramer (Netherlands 1922) is a highly influential designer. He produced numerous pieces for De Cirkel in the period 1948-63; he then founded the Total Design bureau with Wim Crouwel, Benno Wissing, Paul and Dick Schwartz.  His designs are now highly sought after and a plastic version of his "Revolt" chair was reissued by Ahrend in 2004.  The Revolt was recently celebrated in a unique exhibition at Galerie Catherine Houard in Paris.

Dimensions: H 80 cm x W 46 cm x D 48 cm / Seat height 47cm

name: Friso Kramer "Reply" Drafting Table
description:
"Reply" drafting table designed in the 1950s by Friso Kramer and Wim Rietveld for the Dutch manufacturer Ahrend de Cirkel, and inspired by the work of Jean Prouvé.  The design of the drafting table won the "Golden Sign" or "Signe d'Or" in Brussels.

This model has a grey metal frame and large architect's wooden board with the adjusting knob on a longer arm; it is probably best used in the vertical position.  The board could be cut down or replaced to suit your needs.  The piece is in very good condition, with minor signs of use and age to both the frame and the board, and all adjustable feet are in place.  The Ahrend date stamp - showing December 1968 - is intact.

***

The fourth and fifth pictures show an example of a board of standard size in use.  This particular piece is now sold but we can source more if required.

name: Pilastro Coat Hooks
description:
Coat rail by Pilastro comprising five brightly coloured metal coat hooks on a black steel bar.  1950s Netherlands.

Dimensions: Bar Length 63cm x Hook Height 10cm

name: Willy Van Der Meeren Cabinet
description:
Cabinet designed by Willy van der Meeren for Tubax, with sliding doors in blue/grey enamelled steel, and sapele wood sides and long fin-like door pulls.  This rare model has a black metal back, with hanging space on the left and adjustable shelves on the right.

This piece of Belgian social furniture was designed as a wardrobe or locker for schools in the early 1950s.  They are now highly collectable and sought after.  The cabinets are in original but good used condition, with some wear to the wood and metal; the doors have no dents and run well. One grey door has an old light scratch which does not detract from the overall appearance.

Van der Meeren was a Belgian architect and industrial designer who produced a number of designs for Tubax, a manufacturer regarded as a pioneer of Modernism in Belgium.  In 2008 a retrospective of his work was held at the Atomium in Brussels.

These cupboards typically come in two sizes; these are the small model, and we currently have two units available. 

Dimensions:  H: 175 cm x W: 81 cm x D: 50 cm (53cm including handles)

name: Cees Braakman EB04 Desk for Pastoe
description:
EB04 birch desk, with birch bent-plywood legs, designed by Cees Braakman for UMS Pastoe of Utrecht, Netherlands in 1950.

The desk has three drawers to the left and a cupboard with two adjustable shelves to the right, together with an extension leaf to provide additional work surface if required.  The desk is in good condition with signs of use and the patina associated with its age. The drawer and door locks and original Pastoe key are present.

Dimensions: W: 140cm x D: 70cm x H: 72cm

UMS Pastoe are celebrating their 100 year anniversary with a recent exhibition - "Like Pastoe" - at the Kunsthal in Rotterdam, which included an example of this desk.  Cees Braakman was head of the Pastoe design team from 1945 to 1978 and was responsible for the development of their first modern furniture line.  

***
This item is also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: Friso Kramer Reform Table
description:
"Reform" table by Dutch designer Friso Kramer, for Ahrend de Cirkel. 1950s Netherlands. 

Industrial dining or work table with flat light grey steel frame and original dark grey lino top with aluminium edge.  Seats four.  This piece is in good original vintage condition with marks to the top and chips and wear to the edge and frame; all rubber feet are in place and the frame is stamped with the Ahrend mark.  

Dimensions: H 75 cm x W 140 cm x D 70 cm

***

The table is shown with Result chairs also by Friso Kramer, which are listed separately.

name: Teak Sideboard by Clausen and Søn
description:
Teak sideboard manufactured by Clausen & Søn, Silkeborg. Denmark 1960s.

The piece comprises two cupboards with interior shelves, and a central bank of four drawers, all with distinctive bow-tie handles.  The piece is in good condition with the normal marks and patina of its age.

Dimensions:  L: 208cm x D: 46cm x H: 74cm

***
This item is also for sale in our shop so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: Pilastro Coat Rack with Hat Shelf
description:
Wall-mounted coat rack with black end panels, six metal hooks and white perforated metal hat shelf; attributed to Pilastro.  1950s Holland.

The piece is in good original condition, with light signs of use and wear.

name: Tomado Floor-Standing Shelf Unit
description:
Floor-standing shelf unit by Tomado of Holland.  The company was known for producing modular shelving systems, designed by D Dekker in the 1950s, including this quite rare floor unit. 

The piece comprises two metal stands and cross-bars with three metal shelves in red, light grey and mustard yellow.  The unit is finished in its original paintwork with some signs of age-related wear.  All shelves are stamped with the TOMADO-HOLLAND mark.

Dimensions:  H: 84 cm x D: 28 cm x W: 65 cm

name: Brunswick Children's Chairs
description:
1950s children's chairs made by the American manufacturer Brunswick.

The Brunswick Corporation was founded in Ohio in the late 19th century, manufacturing a wide range of products including - by the mid 20th century - bowling balls made from vulcanised rubber and the machine that automated the resetting of bowling pins.  In 1955 Brunswick introduced a line of school furniture including these sturdy but stylish children's chairs, with pointed grey metal legs and plywood seats and back rests. 

We have two chairs available (price is per chair).

Dimensions: H: 67cm x W: 42cm x D: 42cm / Seat height 38cm (or 15")

The chair is pictured here in front of a teak sideboard from the S range by John & Sylvia Reid for Stag.  Please mail us if you would like details.

***

We have other kids' chairs available from Europe (see pictures 4 and 5); please let us know if you would like more information.

name: Galvanitas Pagwood Stacking Chairs
description:
Set of four compass-leg stacking chairs by Galvanitas of the Netherlands for Thur-Op of Switzerland.  1960s.

These chairs have folded steel frames in light grey with Pagwood seats; their clever design makes them easy to stack or fit together to form a bench.  

Dimensions: H: 82cm x W: 48cm x D: 53cm / Seat height 47cm

***
These chairs are also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in them please contact us to reserve for you before clicking the button below.

We also have kids' chairs by Galavanitas; please mail us if you would like more information.

name: Cees Braakman Bookcase for Pastoe
description:
Oak series BE05 bookcase by Cees Braakman for Pastoe.  Early 1950s Netherlands.

The piece has an open shelf and fall-front panel revealing two interior shelves. It is in good condition with a signs of age and use as might be expected, including a little fading where books have been kept and a light water mark on the back. Otherwise the wood has a beautiful patina, the structure is solid and the piece presents well.

Dimensions: H: 81cm x W: 88cm x D: 28cm (top) / 35cm (bottom)

name: Tubax Plywood Chairs
description:
Set of six simple plywood desk or dining chairs by Tubax.  1950s Belgium.  The chairs have a beech plywood seat and backrest screwed into a black tubular steel frame. 

Shown here with Willy Van Der Meeren writing desk, also for Tubax, which is listed separately.

Dimensions: H 76 cm x W 47 cm x D 47 cm / Seat height 46.5 cm

***
These chairs are also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in them please contact us to reserve for you before clicking the button below.

name: Louis Van Teeffelen Shelving Unit
description:
Free-standing wall unit by Louis van Teeffelen for Wébé.  1950s Netherlands.  

The modular unit is made up of four uprights with ant-shaped legs; three teak cabinets and eight shelves, with brass fixings.  The pieces can be reconfigured as two or three bays to suit your needs.  The set is in very good original condition with small signs of use and age. There is a key available for the lockable cabinet.

Dimensions:  H: 200cm x D: 34.5cm x W: 88cm per bay

name: Alfred Hendrickx Oval Dining Table
description: Please note this piece is now sold, however we may be able to source another for you, so please contact us if you would like to discuss further. *** Oval dining table with marble base, stainless steel pedestal and white formica top, by the Belgian designer Alfred Hendrickx for Belform. 1960s Belgium. The table seats 6-8 and is in excellent condition. Dimensions: L: 180 cm x W: 120cm x H: 69cm The table was originally designed to sit low and sleek. Spacers can be added to raise the table top if a little extra height is required.

name: Cees Braakman Teak Desk for Pastoe
description:
Twin pedestal teak desk with floating top by Cees Braakman for Pastoe.  1950s Netherlands.  One door to the left with interior shelves; three drawers to the right.

This desk is an early edition with nickel-plated ribbon legs and chrome handles.  There are some signs of use to the top - from light and general use - but overall the desk is in very good condition with nice grain and lovely patina.

Dimensions:  W: 142cm (width of top: 130cm) x D: 60cm x H: 76cm

UMS Pastoe are celebrating their 100 year anniversary, with a recent exhibition - "Like Pastoe" - at the Kunsthal in Rotterdam.  Cees Braakman was head of the Pastoe design team from 1945 to 1978 and was responsible for the development of their first modern furniture line.  

***
This item is now sold; please contact us if you are interested in something similar.

name: Wall-Mounted Tomado Shelving [Archive]
description:
Wall-mounted modular shelving unit by D Dekker for Tomado.  1950s Holland.

Sets in metal and teak with rare components.

name: Hans Olsen 630/631 Dining Suite
description:
Model 630/631 dining suite designed in the late 1950s by Hans Olsen for Frem Røjle of Denmark.  

The suite comprises four chairs fitting neatly under the extending teak table. The chairs have their original black vinyl upholstery to seat and back rest and are in excellent condition with no rips, tears or creases to the fabric.  The teak table is also in very good condition with a nice patina to the wood.  The extending leaf folds under the table top when not in use.  All pieces are labelled.

Dimensions: H: 74cm x Dia: 120cm extending to 170cm.

name: Cees Braakman Hairpin-Leg Desk [Archive]
description:
Teak writing desk with three hairpin-legs and white painted drawer fronts, designed by Cees Braakman for Pastoe.  1950s Netherlands.

This desk has an asymmetric design with floating top and paper shelf on the right hand side.  It is in good original unrestored condition with normal signs of use, including a little damage to the pedestal where a chair has rubbed over the years.  Overall the desk shows a nice patina associated with age.  

Dimensions: W*: 116 cm x D: 59 cm x 75cm

* Width from outside of drawer unit to edge of paper shelf

name: Kofod Larsen Sideboard for G Plan
description:
Early 1960s teak sideboard  with rosewood handles, designed by the Danish designer Ib Kofod Larsen for the English manufacturer G-Plan.

The exclusive "G-Plan Danish" range was introduced in the early sixties in response to the increasing popularity of imported Scandinavian furniture. The design work was carried out by Kofod Larsen, with finishing typically in teak and rosewood.  The Danish range was more expensive than G-Plan's other products, and these pieces are now relatively rare. The majority of the Danish range carries the gold G-Plan Danish stamp, with Kofod Larsen's signature; this sideboard carries the stamp on an interior shelf.

Dimensions: L: 235cm x D: 48cm x H: 77cm

name: Dutch Plywood Chairs
description:
A set of four 1950s Dutch Plywood chairs by Jan van den Heuvel.  The chairs have shaped plywood seats and back rests, with tubular steel cantilevered frames that reflect the influence of the Bauhaus.  

They are in good vintage condition, with the patina to be expected from their age; the underside of one of the set shows their beautiful logo!

Dimensions: H 85 cm x W 41 cm x D 52 cm / Seat height 46cm

name: Marko Chairs
description:
Set of four beech plywood industrial chairs with light grey metal frames by Marko.  The chairs are in vintage condition with signs of use to both the wooden panels and the frames.  Very nice stylish design with compass legs; the Marko stamp appears on the back of the chair.  1960s Netherlands.

Price for the set of four.  

Please contact us if you require chairs in larger numbers.

name: Green Desk Chair
description:
Heavy desk chair with fully adjustable seat and back rest.  1950s Belgium.

The heavy swivel base is finished in its original paint; the green vinyl upholstery, with black piping is also original.  The chair is in excellent condition with all adjusting mechanisms in good working order; the upholstery has one patch of wear (pictured).

name: Remington Rand Desk Chair
description:
Heavy vintage desk chair by Remington Rand, an American business machines manufacturer who started trading in the 1920s.  We expect this piece to date from the early part of the 20th century (1930s-40s).

This chair has its original dark green vinyl upholstery over a sprung seat, and metal base with casters.  There are a couple of rips to the upholstery at the bottom of the seat, as shown, and light signs of age and use to the metalwork.  The castors run smoothly, and the swivel mechanism works well; all studs on the back rest are in place.  Overall the chair is in very good condition for its age. 

Dimensions: H* 83 cm x W 62 cm x D 62 cm

* The seat height is 49cm

name: Rosewood & Leather Armchairs and Sofa
description:
Pair of low-backed rosewood armchairs, and three-seater sofa, with leather cushions, believed to be Danish 1950s.  The rosewood frames are in good original condition; the black leather cushions have been refinished and have new foam and base fabric.

Dimensions (chairs): H: 72 cm x W: 75 cm x D: 72 cm

Price per piece.

***

The chairs are now SOLD; the matching three-seater sofa is available and in our showroom now.  If you are interested in the sofa please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: DeNisco Coffee Table
description:
Coffee table with glass top and chrome steel frame; the lower tier is rosewood with tiled inlay by DeNisco.  1960s Belgium.

The table shows some signs of wear to the veneer and frame, but the tiles and glass are excellent with no chips or cracks.

Dimensions: W: 115 cm x D: 50 cm x H: 39 cm

name: Leather & Chrome Chairs
description:
Pair of leather and chrome side chairs in heavy tan hide with nice patina.  Both frame and leather are in very good condition with no rips or tears to the seats; the stitching has been professionally renewed by hand to ensure a strong finish.  1960s Netherlands.

Price for the pair.

Dimensions: 
H: 82cm x W: 42cm x D: 52cm 
Height to front of seat: 45cm

name: Friso Kramer "Doe Meer" Stools
description:
"Doe Meer" swivel stool designed by Friso Kramer in the 1960s for Ahrend de Cirkel of Holland.  This stool is height adjustable.

This piece is now sold, however we expect to have more available in the near future.  Please contact us if you would like to know more.

name: Cordemeijer "Cleopatra" Daybed [Archive]
description:
Original "Cleopatra" daybed designed by Dick Cordemeijer for Auping.  1950s Netherlands.

The daybed has a black enameled steel frame, strong wire mesh base and rounded teak end panels.  Newly upholstered in grey hopsack over new foam mattress and bolster cushion.

name: Belgian Sideboard
description:
Teak sideboard with ceramic panel decoration.  The storage comprises two cupboards with adjustable shelves, and four drawers.  Black metal door handles have brass collars.  The piece has the option to be supported by a fifth leg, which fits centrally to the base of the body; all legs are removable.  

Belgian 1960s.  Designer unknown.

Dimensions: L: 200 cm x D: 46 cm x H: 80 cm / without legs 51 cm

***
This item is also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: White & Newton Sideboard
description:
1960s teak sideboard by White & Newton of Portsmouth.  This model has three drawers to the left, with the top drawer being partitioned for cutlery, and two doors to the right.  The piece is in vintage condition with some signs of use and age.

Dimensions:  L: 208cm x D: 46cm x H: 73cm

name: French Folding Table
description:
Early 20th century French work or dining table.  Heavy steel folding base and pear wood top with very nice patina.  Seats 6-8.

Dimensions: L: 180cm x W: 69cm x H: 76cm

name: Cees Braakman Magazine Rack
description:
Magazine racks in beech and teak by Cees Braakman for UMS Pastoe.  1950s Netherlands.

Price per piece.

name: French Writing Desk
description:
Small oak writing desk with compass legs and brass handles. Very nice condition.  1950s French.

Dimensions: W: 100 cm x D: 60 cm x H: 75 cm

name: Chrome Sciolari Chandelier
description:
Large 1960s gothic style chandelier attributed to Gaetano Sciolari.  The design comprises a chrome frame with twelve arms and 48 dear-drop crystals.  Two crystals are missing, but otherwise the piece is in excellent condition.

Dimensions: H* 46cm x Dia: 56cm

* Height from bottom of chain to bottom of crystals; the chain can be adjusted to suit your ceiling height.

Not rewired.

name: Table Lamp by Louis Kalff for Philips
description:
1950s table lamp with metal shade, and brass tripod, designed by Louis Kalff for Philips Lighting of the Netherlands.  

The lamp has been rewired and refinished and takes a standard bayonet fitting bulb.  This model has the yellow Philips label showing manufacture in Belgium.

Dimensions: Dia of shade 28cm x H 33cm

name: Sciolari Cubic Chandelier
description:
Large 17 light "Cubic" chandelier by Gaetano Sciolari.  Chrome frame with lucite shades. 1960s Italian.

Diameter: 70cm

name: 1950s Chandelier
description:
1950s brass chandelier with 8 glass shades and blue painted centre from Belgium.  The chandelier has been newly rewired.

Diameter: 90cm

name: Bubble Lamps
description:
1950s bubble lamps, in good original condition.  Both lamps have new chrome bulb holders taking standard bayonet-fitting bulbs.

Dimensions: 

Onion: H: 33 cm (shade only) x Dia: 34cm
Round: Dia: 33cm

name: Philips Infraphil Lamp
description:
Philips Infraphil lamp, widely associated with the French architect and designer Charlotte Perriand (1903-1999) who included an Infraphil in the 1949 Paris exhibition "Formes Utiles, Objets de Notre Temps" as an example of good design.

These lamps are finished in their original cream aluminium with adjustable red anodised grip and Philips label; they are in very good vintage condition and have been rewired for domestic use, taking a standard bayonet cap bulb.

We have a number of these lamps available.

name: Sciolari Ovali Chandelier
description:
1960s "Ovali" chandelier by Gaetano Sciolari in silverplate and crystal, with six arms.  Excellent overall condition.

We have a pair of these lights available.  Price per piece.

Diameter: 47 cm

name: Sciolari Chandelier
description:
Large 1960s chandelier attributed to Gaetano Sciolari.  The frame is made of gold plated brass with Strass crystals.  The design comprises ten arms, each with many crystals of different sizes and cuts.  A small number of the crystals are missing, but otherwise the piece is in excellent condition.

Diameter: 70cm

***
This item is also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: German Chandelier
description:
Chandelier of brass tubes and cross pieces lit by nine glass globes, in excellent condition.  Possibly manufactured by Glashütte Limburg but with no maker's mark we can't be sure.  1970s German.

Dimensions: W: 60 cm x Drop: 46 cm / Globes are 11 cm in diameter

***
This item is also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: Aluminium Desk Lamp
description: 1960s desk lamp with black base and large aluminium shade.

name: Brass Chandelier
description:
1970s brass chandelier with nine opaque glass shades.  From Germany.

Dimensions: W: 64cm x Drop: 64cm

***
This item is also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: Flying Saucer Lamp
description: 1950s Desk lamp with large metal shade.  From Holland.

name: German "Helo" Desk Lamp
description:
1950s German "Helo" desk lamp.  The lamp has a metal shade and base in black, with brass stem, in used vintage condition.

Dimensions: Shade diameter: 25cm x H: 26cm

***
This item is also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in this piece please contact us to reserve it for you before clicking the button below.

name: Floor-Standing Anglepoise Lamp
description:
Large floor-standing anglepoise-style studio lamp in blue/grey. 

***
One now sold, one coming soon.

name: Kaiser-Style Work Lamp
description: German Kaiser-style industrial work lamp.

name: Philips Table Lamp
description: Philips table lamp designed by Louis Kalff.  This lamp is light grey, with a brass Z-shaped stem.  From Holland.

name: Industrial Metal Stools
description:
Industrial metal stools with beech plywood seats and metal frames.  The metal is painted grey and nicely worn with use and age.  The seat swivels, and is height-adjustable.  1960s Belgian.

Dimensions: H: 55-70cm x Dia (seat) 30cm / Dia (foot rest) 45cm

name: Mid-Century Teak Table
description:
Mid-century extending dining table with teak top and black steel frame.  When the extension leaf is not in use it can be stowed under the table top.  This piece is attributed to Pierre Guariche.

The table is shown here with chairs by Friso Kramer, which are listed separately.

Dimensions:  H: 72.5 cm x W: 130-170 cm x D: 80 cm

name: Tubax Coat Stand
description: 1950s coat stand by Tubax of Belgium.

name: Teak Sofa & Armchairs
description:
1950s teak sofa and armchairs from Belgium.  These pieces have been newly upholstered in grey fabric with new foam and webbing.  

Dimensions:  

Sofa  W: 194cm x D: 81cm x H: 80cm
Chair  W: 73cm x D: 81cm x H: 80cm

name: 1950s French Atomic Coat Racks
description:
1950s French coat racks in black tubular metal with large wooden or metal knobs in red, green and yellow.  

Dimensions:

- Coat and hat rack: W: 69 cm x H: 19 cm x D: 24 cm
- Straight coat racks: W: 73 cm / 42 cm
- Curved coat rack: W: 40 cm
- All knobs are approximately 5-6 cm in diameter.

***
These items are also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in these pieces please contact us to reserve one for you before clicking the button below.

Coat rack bottom left of picture three (3 wooden balls), curved coat rack and the coat/hat rack are now sold.

name: Belgian Cocktail Chair [Archive]
description:
Belgian cocktail chair, newly upholstered in teal hopsack. Expo 58 era.

***
This piece is now sold, however we do look out for good examples of these designs: see separate listings for current stock, or send us an email if you would like to discuss details.

name: Tuxedo-Style Sofa
description:
1960s tuxedo-style sofa with wenge frame, original wool upholstery with new foam and base board.  From Belgium.

The sofa can used with or without the end cushions as shown.

Dimensions: L: 200cm x D: 79cm x H: 70cm

name: French Industrial Locker
description:
Vintage French industrial steel locker, attributed to Strafor.  The locker is divided into three sections, with diamond patterns on the doors, and finished in its original grey paint.  Each section has one shelf, at high level, with one or two hooks below.

Dimensions:  W: 91cm x H: 175cm x D: 43cm including handles

The dimensions of the doors are: W: 26cm x 155cm each.

name: Belarti Plaques
description:
Decorative wall plaques by the Belgian ceramicist, Juliette Belarti.  The plaques each comprise five ceramic tiles on a black wooden panel, in a black steel frame.  They are in excellent original condition.  1950s Belgium.

Dimensions: W: 25cm x H: 87cm including panel.

***
These items are also for sale in our shop, so if you are interested in them please contact us to reserve one for you before clicking the button below.  The plaque on the left in the last picture is now sold.

name: Henrik Horst Sculpture
description:
Large 1960s metal wall sculpture by the Danish artist Henrik Horst in excellent condition.  

Dimensions:  L: 125cm x H: 50cm x D: 6cm

name: Kids Wooden Truck
description: Wooden two-part truck in red and yellow.  English 1960s.

name: Perignem Dish
description:
Ceramic dish, produced by the Perignem studio, Beernem. Grey dots on an orange/red background.  1960s Belgium.

Dimensions: L: 51cm x W: 11cm x D: 3cm

name: Industrial Metal Desk
description:
1950s Belgian industrial metal desks with two drawers to left hand side.  Stripped steel frame with new linoleum top in black.

Dimensions: W: 106cm x D: 61cm x H: 67cm

name: Belgian Steel Desk
description:
1950s tubular steel desk from Belgium.  This industrial desk has a green steel frame, in Bauhaus style, with chrome drawer handles and a solid beech top.

Dimensions: W: 120 cm x D: 72* cm x H: 75.5 cm

* The depth of the top, front to back, is 69cm; the drawer handles add 3cm.

name: 1950s Circular Mirror
description:
1950s Circular mirror with wire frame, in used and loved vintage condition.

Diameter: 48cm

name: Belarti Plaques [Archive]
description:
Decorative wall plaques by the Belgian ceramicist, Juliette Belarti.  The plaques comprise five ceramic tiles in a black steel frame on a teak panel.

Dimensions: W: 25cm x H: 87cm including panel.

name: Chrome Coat Stand
description: 1950s Chrome coat stand with white balls.

name: 1950s Coat Stand
description:
1950s coat stand in dark green painted metal with black balls and hooks giving 12 hanging points.  Ex-military.  From Belgium.

Dimensions: H: 180cm x 66cm diameter at top

We have a number of coat stands - in this and similar designs - in chrome and painted metal.  Please let us know if you would like more details.

name: 1950s French Coat Rack
description:
1950s French coat rack in aluminium.  This simple wall-mounted coat rack has a swivel mirror, four hooks and a shelf for your hats.

These pieces also work well in the bathroom for your robes and towels.

Dimensions: W: 58cm x H: 31cm x D: 21cm

name: 1950s Desk Chair
description: 1950s desk chair with green vinyl upholstery and chrome arms.  This chair swivels on a heavy metal base.

name: Black Leather Lounge Chair
description:
1960s lounge chair with chrome base, from Belgium.  This chair has original black leather upholstery with new seat webbing and base fabric.

Dimensions: W: 83cm x D: 83cm x H: 72cm

name: Rosewood Skovby Dining Table
description:
Rosewood dining table.  Made in Denmark and attributed to 1970s Skovby.  The table seats 6, extending to seat 8 or 10 with two separate leaves that can be kept under the table when not in use.  

Dimensions:  L: 164cm x W: 100cm x H: 74cm

Length extends to 214cm with one leaf, or 264cm with two.

name: Wall-Mounted Coat Racks [Archive]
description:
Wall-mounted coat rack and hat shelf.  The coat rack has a black steel or chrome frame with teak slats, and double hooks in chrome which can be positioned as required.  From Holland.

Dimensions: W: 80cm x D: 25cm x H: 109cm

name: Aluminium Desk Chair
description: 1950s desk chair with aluminium base and black vinyl seat and back.  Height-adjustable.

name: Stone Coffee Table
description:
1960s stone coffee table with metal base.

Dimensions:  L: 120cm x W: 50cm x H: 36cm

name: 1960s Metal Desk
description:
Small 1960s metal desk with four slim drawers; grey painted metal frame and original black linoleum top.  From Belgium.  

Shown here with a grey vinyl and chrome desk chair by Strafor of France (available separately).

This metal desk and chair have now sold, however we have a number of the Strafor chairs, and a range of desks in stock which we will be listing soon.

name: 1950s Teak Armchair
description:
1950s teak armchair, newly upholstered in grey fabric, from Belgium.  We have two of these chairs available (price per chair).

Dimensions: W: 74cm x D: 73cm x H: 76cm

The armchairs are shown here with a stone coffee table on a chrome frame, which is listed separately.

name: Belarti Tiled Occasional Tables [Archive]
description:
1950s tiled table with yellow and black pattern by J Belarti, with black metal base. Signed. 

Dimensions: L: 63cm x D: 32cm x H: 45cm

***

1960s occasional tiled table.  Black steel table featuring four ceramic tiles - with designs in orange, black and green.  Signed. 

Dimensions: L: 31cm x D: 31cm x H: 36cm

***

1950s magazine rack with a black steel frame.  The top features vivid green tiles.  Signed.  Dimensions: L: 47cm x D: 27cm x H: 48cm

***

These pieces are now sold, however we do look out for good examples of these designs, so please drop us a note if you're interested in something similar.

name: Belarti Tiled Coffee Tables [Archive]
description:
1960s coffee tables with ceramic tiles in a black steel surround, and chrome or steel base, by the Belgian ceramicist Juliette Belarti.

Typical dimensions: L: 109cm x D: 47cm x H: 39cm

***
These pieces are now sold, however we do look out for good examples of these tables, so please drop us a note if you're interested in something similar, or check our other listings for pieces currently available.
